House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00043
FULL TITLE : SAD STATE OF INTERNET ACCESS IN THE PHILIPPINES
SHORT TITLE : Poor Internet Connection
ABSTRACT : Recognized by the Chair on motion of Rep. Gullas, Rep. Enrico A. Pineda from 1-PACMAN Party-List first emphasized the important role as well as the social and economic impact of telecommunications throughout the world, this as he noted that reliable networks could be found in top industrialized nations while developing countries are still working diligently to attain this level. As he observed that the Philippines has been lagging behind in terms of internet connectivity and cellular services that it has already been outranked by its neighboring countries, he lamented that the Filipinos also suffer from costly broadband and internet charges. He thereafter emphasized the National Telecommunications Commission’s (NTC) task of reviewing and safeguarding the operations of the telecom industry, particularly in the light of President Rodrigo R. Duterte’s warning to telecommunications companies (Telcos) “to shape up or face the consequences.” He concluded that the Filipinos deserve better services which, he hoped, would be provided by the telcos. (SOURCE: House Journal No.11,p.18)
